subject: Sleep
title: Swifts That Never Land
description: Learn Swifts That Never Land in one minute.

hook.text: Common swifts stay airborne for up to ten months without landing once. They eat, mate, and sleep in the air.

buildup.text: After fledging, young swifts may not touch the ground for two to three years until they first breed.

discovery.text: They ascend to high altitudes at dusk and enter gliding sleep, alternating brain hemispheres while circling.

twist.text: Their tiny feet have evolved to grip vertical surfaces for nesting but are nearly useless for walking on the ground.

climax.text: The swift's entire life is built around aerial existence. Sleep simply had to adapt to life in the sky.

punchline.text: Swifts don't just fly to live. They live to fly.

quiz.question: How long can common swifts stay airborne continuously?
